result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vladimir Rodriguez-Rodriguez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vladimir Rodriguez-Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Attorney John Stephen Joyce in court for Vladimir Rodriguez-Rodriguez. Assistant District Attorney Michael Jerome Lonski in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendants appearance waived.  Case is scheduled for final pretrial and jury trial in br 45.  If any Evidentiary motions are to be filed, they must be filed by 10/28/22 with response/reply due 11/18/22. All pretrial documents are to be filed with the Court 48 hours in advance of final pretrial.   mn
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 20, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John Stephen Joyce in court, defendant Vladimir Rodriguez-Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's appearance waived.  The defendant is being held on Federal Detainer at this time.  Defense counsel withdrew the bail motion and requests this matter adjourned for scheduling in Br 45.  mn  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney John Stephen Joyce in court, defendant Vladimir Rodriguez-Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn as interpreter: Liesl Monroy.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Court is in receipt of a bail motion filed by defense. Court adjourns matter for a bail/bond hearing.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room G55 in CJF.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bail, filed.

Defendant Vladimir Rodriguez-Rodriguez in court with Attorney John Stephen Joyce; both appear by video.  Defendant Vladimir Rodriguez-Rodriguez in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Reme Bashi and Kelley Salas.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective B. Maciejewski. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 060121,
Payable Number: 1016616,
Receipt Number: 22RP026375,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Vladimir Rodriguez-Rodriguez in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Vladimir Rodriguez-Rodriguez in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Vladimir Rodriguez-Rodriguez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room 502 SB  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
